AllProjects.Name: weatherapp
AllProjects.Description: WeatherApp is a simple weather application showing a four-day forecast with temperatures, relative humidity, wind speed, and wind direction. The application retrieves the current location via cell ID or GPS or a user-defined location and uses it to retrieve the weather forecast.

AllProjects.Name: lwuit-slide-puzzle
AllProjects.Description: Slide Puzzle is a game for Nokia Asha software platform and Series 40 phones created with LWUIT library. Among other things, it demonstrates dragging, different layouts and painters, and also shows how to make custom LWUIT components.

AllProjects.Name: lwuit-rlinks
AllProjects.Description: RLinks is a Reddit client ported to Nokia Asha software platform Series 40 touch phones from its Android counterpart. In this version of the application, the UI has been re-implemented using LWUIT (Lightweight User Interface Toolkit) for Nokia Asha platform and Series 40.

AllProjects.Name: amaze
AllProjects.Description: 3D maze game for Nokia Asha software platform and Series 40 full touch phones. This Nokia example game demonstrates the use of Mobile 3D Graphics API, gestures and accelerometer sensor. The concept of the game is classic and simple: guide the marble through the maze by tilting the phone until the time runs out. The gestures utilised in the game are pinch-to-zoom and double tap.

AllProjects.Name: nokia-asha-ui-component-demos
AllProjects.Description: This example application demonstrates the basic use of LCDUI components. The example is meant for both designers and developers: designers get an impression of how the components actually look on the device and developers learn how to use the LCDUI UI components.

AllProjects.Name: composed-ui
AllProjects.Description: Composed UI, an example application for Nokia Asha software platform, combines three different user interface implementations for presenting list based data: split view, list view and grid view. The split view and the grid view utilise custom, grid layout. The list items in the split view are also custom items. All the views in the application are Form based. The example also demonstrates how to manage persistent data including storing and restoring the application state.

AllProjects.Name: explonoid
AllProjects.Description: Explonoid is yet another Arkanoid clone, but with electric frosting. It demonstrates one way of covering practically all screen sizes using a scaling algorithm for the graphics. The game supports both keyboard and touch screens. When running on phones based on Nokia Asha software platform 1.0 and Series 40 Developer Platform 2.0 (full touch UI) acceleration sensors are supported.

AllProjects.Name: nokia-asha-music-explorer
AllProjects.Description: Nokia Music provides APIs for accessing the vast music collection. In this example usage of the Nokia Music REST API is demonstrated. The example application uses the Tantalum5 library in handling the communication with the API. The user interface is implemented with LCDUI components.

AllProjects.Name: picasa-viewer
AllProjects.Description: This Nokia example application demonstrates the use of the cross-platform development library, Tantalum 5. The application features images from the Picasa web gallery and allows the user to search for specific images from the service. Furthermore, the example application demonstrates adaptive design, performance, JSON parsing, advanced caching and cross-platform techniques in Java applications.

AllProjects.Name: rlinks
AllProjects.Description: This Nokia Java ME example is a Reddit client application demonstrating how to port a network and content-intensive utility application from Android to Nokia Asha software platform and Series 40 touch phones.

AllProjects.Name: status-shout
AllProjects.Description: This Nokia example demonstrates how to utilise the Share API on Nokia Asha software platform to share images and messages to various destinations. The app also implements OAuth authorisation for Facebook.

AllProjects.Name: s40-iap-samples
AllProjects.Description: Nokia In-Application Payment examples for Nokia Asha software platform.

AllProjects.Name: beta-labs-client
AllProjects.Description: A Nokia Developer example application, implemented with Qt Quick, that allows users to browse the applications in Nokia Beta Labs. The application also features the use of in-app advertising.

AllProjects.Name: airswype
AllProjects.Description: AirSwype is a game where the user must draw the presented figure to the air by the phone as precise as possible, written in Qt

AllProjects.Name: bullet-dice
AllProjects.Description: This Qt example application demonstrates the deployment of external physics library, Bullet Physics Library (or Bullet for short), with an QtOpenGL application.

AllProjects.Name: bubble-level-qt
AllProjects.Description: Demo of integrating Qt Quick and Qt Mobility to Qt application.

AllProjects.Name: epong
AllProjects.Description: ePong game is an easy to understand game example originally for Symbian^3 platform and later for MeeGo platform as well.

AllProjects.Name: filelist
AllProjects.Description: A Nokia Developer Qt Quick example application for browsing multimedia files on a Symbian device.

AllProjects.Name: guitar-tuner
AllProjects.Description: Qt Quick example demonstrating integration of Qt audio interfaces by a guitar tuner.

AllProjects.Name: lucid
AllProjects.Description: Simple screensaver project for Qt on Symbian

AllProjects.Name: mirrorhouse
AllProjects.Description: A Nokia Developer Qt Quick example application demonstrating real-time camera image manipulation.

AllProjects.Name: open-book
AllProjects.Description: A Qt A Nokia example app featuring a 3D book implemented with OpenGL ES 2.0.

AllProjects.Name: qoat-of-the-hill
AllProjects.Description: A classic Scorched Earth / Worms clone with two players trying to knock each other off a randomly generated mountain with the shock waves from their exploding ammunition. All the graphics in the game are rendered with native OpenGL ES 2.0.

AllProjects.Name: qt-ui-component-demos
AllProjects.Description: A Nokia Developer Qt Quick example application demonstrating the proper use of UI elements and interaction patterns based on the Symbian Design Guidelines and implemented with Qt Quick Components.

AllProjects.Name: quickhit
AllProjects.Description: Space Invaders like Qt Quick game example with level plug-ins. The latest version of the example demonstrates the use of the In-Application Purchase API.

AllProjects.Name: rentbook
AllProjects.Description: RentBook is a Nokia Developer Qt example application for keeping track of items for rent.

AllProjects.Name: restful-places-around
AllProjects.Description: RESTful Places Around demonstrates the use of the Nokia RESTful Places API within a Qt Quick application.

AllProjects.Name: solitaire-qt
AllProjects.Description: Solitaire Qt game example

AllProjects.Name: space-blok-qt
AllProjects.Description: 1-4 player game where the players must break the 3D block structure with balls.

AllProjects.Name: weather-forecast
AllProjects.Description: A Nokia Developer example application ported from Windows Phone to Qt. This simple Qt Quick application parses the weather forecast content from XML data retrieved over the network.

AllProjects.Name: weekly-planner-qt
AllProjects.Description: The Qt Weekly Planner Example Application demonstrates view navigation with a Windows Phone-like Pivotal navigation component

AllProjects.Name: videoplayer
AllProjects.Description: The Custom VideoPlayer Component provides a reusable QML component that implements transparent overlay controls on top of video content. The VideoPlayer Component demonstrates how to use QML video playing capabilities. It also has a rich and informative UI around the video, or alternatively, a full-screen video view with controls that can be hidden.

AllProjects.Name: video-streamer
AllProjects.Description: The Video Streamer example application demonstrates how to use QML video playing capabilities. It contains a rich and informative UI with view navigation, video playback, and transitions. The latest version (1.1.0->) of the application also supports the In-App Analytics. The Qt Quick UI components have been used for e.g. the navigation (PageStack, ToolBar), Dialogs and Buttons etc.

AllProjects.Name: raptor
AllProjects.Description: Raptor is a modern build system for Symbian code, running on both Windows and Linux.

AllProjects.Name: diner-qt
AllProjects.Description: The Diner example application demonstrates how QML can be used to build a simple, impressive catalog-type application based on local XML data.

AllProjects.Name: media-browser
AllProjects.Description: The Media Browser example application demonstrates how to use Qt Mobility Gallery API QML bindings, to create a visually appealing coverflow view, and to view still images and play video files.

AllProjects.Name: compass-qt
AllProjects.Description: A Nokia Developer Qt Quick example application demonstrating the use of the Qt Location API and Nokia Maps with the compass sensor.

AllProjects.Name: dj-turntable
AllProjects.Description: Qt Quick example demonstrating integration of Qt audio interfaces by a scratchable turntable and drum machine where you may create your own beats.

AllProjects.Name: drumkit-qt
AllProjects.Description: Qt Drumkit is a virtual drumkit which lets you play percussion sounds by tapping the screen.

AllProjects.Name: qt-gameenabler
AllProjects.Description: A set of classes for developing OpenGL ES 2.0 games for mobile devices with Qt

AllProjects.Name: matchem-poker-qt
AllProjects.Description: Arcade style match-n game with poker hands for Qt, WP and iOS devices.

AllProjects.Name: mine-sweeper
AllProjects.Description: Mine Sweeper game implement with Qt SpriteBatch and Qt GameEnabler.

AllProjects.Name: qt-nfc-samples
AllProjects.Description: NFC Peer-to-Peer Example is a sample application that demonstrates how to use the peer-to-peer communication between multiple NFC devices using the NFC LLCP communication protocol.

AllProjects.Name: battle-tank
AllProjects.Description: This is a tank game created with Java ME. It demonstrates the usage of gaming features in Java ME such as sprites, tiles and collision detection. In the game the player's objective is to defend the base and destroy all enemy tanks.

AllProjects.Name: frameanimator-demo
AllProjects.Description: FrameAnimator is a simple application that shows a list that can be scrolled up and down. It uses the FrameAnimator and Gesture APIs available on Series 40 and Asha software platform.

AllProjects.Name: frozen-bubble
AllProjects.Description: This Java ME example application demonstrates how to port a full screen game from Android to Java ME in Nokia Asha software platform and Series 40 touch phones.

AllProjects.Name: fuel-calculator
AllProjects.Description: Fuel Calculator is an example app demonstrating how to use JSR-238 for internationalization (I18N) in Java ME, Nokia Asha software platform.

AllProjects.Name: image-scaling-example
AllProjects.Description: Image Scaler is a simple example MIDlet for Series 40 devices, demonstrating the use of different image scaling algorithms and allowing their comparison in both performance and quality.

AllProjects.Name: qt-creator-projects-plugin
AllProjects.Description: A plug-in for Qt Creator that allows developers to manage their source and tickets in Trac. The plug-in is developed to work with Nokia Developer Projects (Trac MultiProject), but should be compatible with any Trac installation with XML-RPC enabled.

AllProjects.Name: drumkit-jme
AllProjects.Description: Drumkit is a virtual drumkit which lets you play percussion sounds by tapping the screen. You can record your beats and play them back later. It is also possible to play on top of your latest recording.

AllProjects.Name: symbian-qt-sdk-for-linux
AllProjects.Description: Qt SDK for Linux with Symbian Anna and Belle SDKs with Qt 4.7.3 and Qt 4.7.4 (Beta).

AllProjects.Name: trac-batchmodify

AllProjects.Name: trac-childtickets
AllProjects.Description: ChildTickets is a Trac plug-in that provides support for pseudo child-tickets and a visual reference to these within parent ticket. This is the multiproject modified fork. Original author is Mark Ryan. Official project page is: ​http://trac-hacks.org/wiki/ChildTicketsPlugin

AllProjects.Name: trac-downloads

AllProjects.Name: paint
AllProjects.Description: This example MIDlet shows you how to create a simple touch-based paint application. The MIDlet allows the user to draw on the screen, change the brush size and colour, clear the screen, and save the drawn image in the ​BMP file format to the default photo folder.

AllProjects.Name: photo-album
AllProjects.Description: This Series 40 web app example uses the Flickr API as a data source for a beautiful and fluid photo gallery app.

AllProjects.Name: racer
AllProjects.Description: This example MIDlet shows you how to use the Gesture API to implement touch interaction in a game application. This example also covers some key points to consider when developing a game for the Nokia Asha software platform and Series 40.

AllProjects.Name: s40-ui-component-demos
AllProjects.Description: This example application demonstrates the basic use of LCDUI components. The example is meant for both designers and developers: designers get an impression of how the components actually look on the device and developers learn how to use the LCDUI UI components.

AllProjects.Name: sudokumaster-jme
AllProjects.Description: This Java ME application demonstrates how to design a simple game, add dynamic layout control for multiple screen resolutions, and use several input methods (key, touch, and key & touch).

AllProjects.Name: tic-tac-toe-jme
AllProjects.Description: Tic-Tac-Toe Over Sockets port for Series 40 touch and type and full touch devices. This Nokia example demonstrates the use of datagrams for peer discovery and the use of TCP sockets for peer-to-peer communication.

AllProjects.Name: tourist-attractions
AllProjects.Description: Tourist Attractions is a location-aware city guide that presents the most notable sights nearby and gives interesting information on them. The application shows how to use the Java ME Location API and the JSR-179 Location API.

AllProjects.Name: lwuit-paint-calculator
AllProjects.Description: This app demonstrates how to make your LWUIT apps localizable.

AllProjects.Name: lwuit-tourist-attractions
AllProjects.Description: LWUIT Tourist Attractions is a remake of Tourist Attractions application, developed with LWUIT (Light-Weight User Interface Toolkit).

AllProjects.Name: web-apps-ui-component-demos
AllProjects.Description: This simple example application demonstrates the basic use of the S40 Web Apps HTML "UI Components" (i.e. Code Snippets)

AllProjects.Name: compass-jme
AllProjects.Description: Java ME Compass example targeted especially to Series 40 GPS enabled devices. This is a simple application to demonstrate GPS features in Nokia devices.

AllProjects.Name: wordpress
AllProjects.Description: A simple Wordpress blog administration client written in Java ME. It demonstrates the use of the qwerty keyboard and a wide screen in text heavy applications.

AllProjects.Name: here-maps-component-demos
AllProjects.Description: Source code and demonstrations of a series of map components using the HERE Maps API for Java ME plugin. The examples are meant to show how to use the various functions of the API and include a series of demos specifically enhanced to use the additional capabilities of full touch phones.

AllProjects.Name: fm-radio
AllProjects.Description: FM Radio MIDlet demonstrating AMMS tuner capability. You can search frequencies up and down and the frequencies found are saved to the stations list. When MIDlet is closed the stations list is saved to record store.

AllProjects.Description: This is a sample PHP sample application calls the Graph API to manage Azure Active Directory Extensions. It demonstrates how to first register new extensions, then shows the application reading, udpated and deleting values in the Extension attribute.

AllProjects.Description: RMS Samples for .NET

AllProjects.Description: HealthVault Library for Windows 8

AllProjects.Description: Send a Message to the presenter using Service Bus

AllProjects.Description: This repo houses a URL Shortening service written in PHP for Windows Azure Websites.

AllProjects.Description: This repo is for an iOS client application for the URL Shortening service.

AllProjects.Name: UrlShortener-Android-Client
AllProjects.Description: This repo is for an Android client application for the URL Shortening service.

AllProjects.Name: Geolocation-PHP-Service
AllProjects.Description: This repo houses a PHP service layer for storing and retrieving geotagged points.  It also acts as an interface for getting a shared access signature for uploading a blob to Windows Azure Storage.

AllProjects.Name: Geolocation-iOS-Client
AllProjects.Description: This repo houses an iOS client for for the Geolocation service.   It shows on a map all near by tagged points and allows the user to tag new points with photos and videos.

AllProjects.Name: Geolocation-Android-Client

AllProjects.Description: This utlity exposes a URL via an IHttpHandler implementation. When hit, the code for this handler zips up all of the Web Site's log files into a ZIP archive. The archive is then persisted to Windows Azure Blob Storage

AllProjects.Description: HTML with ASP.NET Web API using spatial types and Entity Framework in Bing Maps

AllProjects.Description: Links to open source projects used to create the mobile enterprise app that John Shewchuk demoed at Cloud Expo 2013

AllProjects.Name: HOL-AdvancedWebWorkerRoles
AllProjects.Description: This lab introduces these new capabilities that are unlocked in Windows Azure and allow more advanced application scenarios.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-BuildingSocialGame
AllProjects.Description: In this lab, you will learn how to add Social Gaming features to your applications such as inviting friends using ACS and Social Providers, allow multi-players using both Storage Polling and NodeJs approaches and generate a leaderboard to show the top users' scores.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-IntroToCloudServices
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will explore the basic elements of a Windows Azure Cloud Service by creating a simple GuestBook application that demonstrates many features of web and worker roles, blob storage, table storage, and queues.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-MigratingAspNetApps
AllProjects.Description: In this lab, you will learn how to migrate ASP.NET applications (either MVC or Web Forms) to use the ASP.NET Azure Providers and enable the application to run in Windows Azure.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-IntroSQLDatabase
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will walk through a series of simple use cases for Windows Azure SQL Database such as: managing logins, creating database objects and query your database.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-BuildingAppsWithCaching
AllProjects.Description: In this lab, you will learn how to use the Windows Azure Caching service for both your ASP.NET session state and to cache data from your data-tier. You will see how the Caching service provides your application with a cache that provides low latency and high throughput without having to configure, deploy, or manage the service.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-FederatedAuthWebRole
AllProjects.Description: This hands-on lab provides step-by-step guides for hosting in Windows Azure (WAZ) a Web application accepting identities from an external identity provider: with the authentication functions being performed by an external identity provider, you are now free to focus on the business function of your application instead of worrying of low level details. As you will learn while you go though the lab, this is easily accomplished by taking advantage of Windows Identity Foundation (WIF), formerly known as Geneva, for enhancing your web site.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-Windows8NotificationsHTMLJS
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will learn how to deploy a pre-packaged version of the Windows Azure Toolkit for Windows 8 to Windows Azure and then utilize this deployment to send notifications to your client application via the Windows Push Notification Service (WNS).

AllProjects.Name: HOL-Windows8NotificationsCS
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will learn how to deploy a pre-packaged version of the Windows Azure Toolkit for Windows 8 to Windows Azure and then utilize this deployment to send notifications to your client application via the Windows Push Notification Service (WNS).

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ACSwithLocalSTS
AllProjects.Description: In this intermediate hands-on lab you will learn how to use the Access Control Service for managing trust relationships with multiple business identity providers. You will learn how to use ACS for establishing relationships and normalizing attributes without having to touch your application's source code. The lab will demonstrate how to configure ACS both via the Windows Azure Portal and the management API.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-WebServiceAndIdentity
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will learn how to use claims-based identity for handling authentication and access management for your WCF services hosted in Windows Azure.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ASPNETAzureWebSitesWebMatrix
AllProjects.Description: In this Hands-on Lab you will learn how to use Microsoft WebMatrix 2 to build and publish web sites in Windows Azure. Through the exercises, you will create a new Web Site from the Windows Azure Management Portal and start to build your Web Site locally using WebMatrix. By using a WebMatrix out-of-the-box template, you will quickly create a photo gallery application and customize it by adding a Facebook Like button. Finally, you will publish the resulting web application to Windows Azure using WebMatrix built-in publishing support.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ASPNETAzureWebSitesVS2012
AllProjects.Description: In this Hands-on Lab, you will explore the basic elements of the Windows Azure Web Sites service by creating a simple ASP.NET MVC 4 application, which uses scaffolding to automatically generate the baseline of your application's CRUD (Create, Read, Update and Delete). Then, you will deploy it using Web Deploy from Visual Studio 2012 and Git commit.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ASPNETAzureWebSitesTFS
AllProjects.Description: This hands-on lab will introduce you to using Windows Azure Web Sites with Visual Studio 2012 and Team Foundation Server (TFS). In this lab you will create a new Windows Azure Web Site. Then, you'll connect it to a TFS project and use Visual Studio 2012 to create a site. Then, you'll commit the code for the site back to TFS and kick off the continuous integration features, which will automatically deploy the site to Windows Azure Web Sites upon each commit.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-BuildingWindows8AppsWithWindowsAzure
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how to combine the fluency of Windows 8 applications with the power of Windows Azure: From a Windows Metro Style application, you will consume an ASP.NET MVC 4 Web API service published in Windows Azure Web Sites, and store your data in a Windows Azure SQL Database. In addition, you will learn how to configure the Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) in your app to send toast notifications from your service to all the registered clients.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-NodejsAzureWebSites
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will learn the basics of the Windows Azure Web Sites service for Node.js applications. In Exercise 1, you will see how to use the Windows Azure portal for creating a web site and then publish a Hello World Node.js app by using Git. In Exercise 2, you will learn how to use the Node.js Command-Line Tools for publishing applications. Finally, in exercise 3 you will explore the WebMatrix 2 features for building and deploying Node.js web applications in Windows Azure.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-PHPAppsAzureWebSites-OSX
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will explore the basic elements of the Windows Azure Web Sites service by creating a simple PHP application and deploying it using FTP deployment feature.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-DeploySharePointVMs
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how to create a SharePoint farm, connected with Active Directory and SQL Server.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-NodejsAzureWebSites-OSX
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will learn the basics of the Windows Azure Web Sites service for Node.js applications. In Exercise 1, you will see how to use the Windows Azure portal for creating a web site and then publish a "Hello World" Node.js application using GIT. In Exercise 2, you will learn how to use the Node.js Command-Line Tools for publishing applications.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-NodejsAzureWebSitesVMs-OSX
AllProjects.Description: A virtual machine in Windows Azure is a server in the cloud that you can control and manage. After you create a virtual machine in Windows Azure, you can start, stop, and delete it whenever you need to, and you can access the virtual machine just as you do with a server in your office. In this lab, you will learn how to create a virtual machine running Linux and use it as a database server for a Node.js application. You will see how diverse technologies can run and interact in Windows Azure's cloud-based infrastructure.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ASPNETAzureWebSites
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will explore the basic elements of the Windows Azure Web Sites service by creating a simple ASP.NET MVC 4 application, which uses scaffolding to automatically generate the baseline of your application's CRUD (Create, Read, Update and Delete). You will then deploy the application using both Web Deploy from Visual Studio 2010 and Git.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-WebAppGalleryAzureWebSites-OSX
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how to create a new web site in Windows Azure by using a template from the pre-packaged applications gallery. Once created, you will edit the site using a text editor and update the site using FTP.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-WebAppGalleryAzureWebSites
AllProjects.Description: In this Hands-On Lab you will learn how to create a new Web Site in Windows Azure by using a template from the pre-packaged applications gallery. After successful creation you will update the site using Web Matrix and deploy the changes.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-DeployingActiveDirectory
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will walk through the steps required to deploy an Active Directory domain in the cloud and provision new virtual machines into this domain.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-DeployingActiveDirectoryPS
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will walk through the steps required to deploy an Active Directory domain in the cloud and provision new virtual machines into this domain.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-DeployingSQLServer
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how to create and configure a SQL Server 2012 instance in a Windows Azure Virtual Machine.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-UnderstandingVMImagingWithCapture
AllProjects.Description: In this hands on lab you will walk through creating a customized virtual machine that is customized to be remotely manageable via PowerShell. You will then learn how to generalize it and save it is an image so that all new virtual machines provisioned from it will be remotely manageable by default.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-UnderstandingVMImagingWithCapturePS
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will walk through creating a customized virtual machine that is customized to be remotely manageable via PowerShell. You will then learn how to generalize it and save it is an image so that all new virtual machines provisioned from it will be remotely manageable by default.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ASPNETAzureWebSitesVMSQL
AllProjects.Description: In this lab, you will learn how to create ASP.NET web applications that connect to virtual machines hosted in Windows Azure. You will learn how to create a Virtual Machine with SQL Server 2012 installed using the Windows Azure Management Portal and configure it to allow external connections. Then, you will create a simple ASP.NET MVC 4 Web application using Entity Framework that access the database in the SQL Server virtual machine. The web application will take advantage of Full-Text Search features in SQL Server 2012 to search for contacts data. Finally, you will deploy the application to Windows Azure Web Sites using Visual Studio.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-DeployingSQLServerForSharePoint
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how to create and configure a virtual machine running SQL Server 2012 as part of the deploying a SharePoint farm hands on lab.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-HadoopOnWindowsAzure
AllProjects.Description: This hands-on lab shows two ways to run MapReduce programs in a Hadoop on Azure cluster and how to analyse data imported into the cluster from Excel using Hive-based connectivity.

AllProjects.Name: Demo-WeatherService
AllProjects.Description: Documentation for The WeatherService Demo created using Windows Azure Job Scheduler SDK.

AllProjects.Name: DEMO-MigratingWebFarm
AllProjects.Description: This demo shows how you can easily migrate an application that runs in a web farm environment to Windows Azure.

AllProjects.Name: DEMO-ImagingVMs
AllProjects.Description: Demonstration on Imaging Virtual Machines

AllProjects.Name: DEMO-UsingCSUpload
AllProjects.Description: Using CSUpload to upload VHDs to a Windows Azure Storage Account and attach them to a Virtual Machine

AllProjects.Name: DEMO-ScaleUpDown
AllProjects.Description: Demo that shows how to use PowerShell to import and export virtual machines on a schedule to save money.

AllProjects.Name: DEMO-GettingStartedVMs
AllProjects.Description: Getting Started with Virtual Machines

AllProjects.Name: DEMO-LoadBalancingAvailability
AllProjects.Description: Demonstration that shows how to configure load balancing and availability sets.

AllProjects.Name: DEMO-ConnectingCloudServices
AllProjects.Description: Demonstrates how to connect cloud services using a virtual network. Scenario is a PaaS app communicating with a virtual machine.

AllProjects.Name: DEMO-DeployingAD
AllProjects.Description: Demonstration that shows how to deploy virtual machines into an Active Directory environment.

AllProjects.Name: Demo-UrlShortener-PHP
AllProjects.Description: This repo houses a URL Shortening service written in PHP for Windows Azure Websites.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-Windows8AndMobileServices
AllProjects.Description: In this HOL you will learn how you can leverage Visual Studio 2012 and Windows Azure Mobile Services to add structured storage, push notifications and integrated authentication to your Windows Store applications.

AllProjects.Name: PRESENTATION-WindowsAzureCloudServices
AllProjects.Description: This presentation covers the basic concepts of Windows Azure Cloud Services such as roles, instances and configuration.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-IntroToCloudServices-VS2012
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will explore the basic elements of a Windows Azure Cloud Service by creating a simple GuestBook application that demonstrates many features of web and worker roles, blob storage, table storage, and queues.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ServiceBusMessaging-VS2012
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will explore the basic elements of a Windows Azure service by creating a simple GuestBook application that demonstrates many features of Windows Azure, including web and worker roles, blob storage, table storage, and queues.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-TrafficManager-VS2012
AllProjects.Description: Windows Azure Traffic Manager enables you to manage and distribute incoming traffic to your Windows Azure cloud services whether they are deployed in the same data center or in different centers across the world. In this hands-on lab, you will explore different load balancing policies available in Traffic Manager and how you can use them to enhance performance, increase availability, and balance traffic to your hosted services.

AllProjects.Name: DEMO-DeployingHybrid
AllProjects.Description: Deploying a site to site Windows Azure Virtual Network with a Cisco ASA 5505 (Click Through)

AllProjects.Name: DEMO-MigrateVMAppController
AllProjects.Description: Demonstration of using AppController to migrate a SharePoint VM to the cloud with a hybrid network (Click Through).

AllProjects.Name: PRESENTATION-WindowsAzureITProOverview
AllProjects.Description: Windows Azure Overview for IT Professionals

AllProjects.Name: HOL-DeployingCloudServices-VS2012
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how to deploy your Cloud Services in Windows Azure. The lab walks through the process using a simple application named myTODO, which is a simple list creation and management application built using ASP.NET MVC. The lab shows the steps required for provisioning the required components in the Windows Azure Management Portal, uploading the service package, and configuring the service. You will see how you can test your application in a staging environment and then promote it to production once you are satisfied that it is operating according to your expectations.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-Windows8AndMobileServicesJS
AllProjects.Description: The best apps need cloud services. Use this HOL to see how you can leverage Visual Studio 2012 and the new functionality in Windows Azure to add structured storage, integrated authentication and even Push Notifications in literally minutes to your Windows 8 Store app.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ServiceBusServiceRemoting-VS2012
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how to provision an Service Bus account and configure namespaces for you service. You will take advantage of Windows Azure Access Control Service to provide claims-based authentication, creating rules that map an identity into claims that determine what actions an issuer is allowed to perform.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ASPNETAzureWebSitesVMSQL-VS2012
AllProjects.Description: In this lab, you will learn how to create ASP.NET web applications that connect to virtual machines hosted in Windows Azure. You will learn how to create a Virtual Machine with SQL Server 2012 installed using the Windows Azure Management Portal and configure it to allow external connections. Then, you will create a simple ASP.NET MVC 4 Web application using Entity Framework that access the database in the SQL Server virtual machine. The web application will take advantage of Full-Text Search features in SQL Server 2012 to search for contacts data. Finally, you will deploy the application to Windows Azure Web Sites using Visual Studio.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-MigratingAspNetApps-VS2012
AllProjects.Description: In this lab, you will learn how to migrate ASP.NET applications (either MVC or Web Forms) to use the ASP.NET Azure Providers and enable the application to run in Windows Azure.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-DebuggingCloudServices-VS2012
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on Lab, you will learn how to deploy a simple ASP.NET MVC4 Web application to a Web server hosted in Windows Azure, using SQL Server and configuring load balancing.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-IntroSQLDatabase-VS2012
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will walk through a series of simple use cases for Windows Azure SQL Database such as: managing logins, creating database objects and query your database.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ExploringStorage-VS2012
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will examine each of the foundation storage capabilities of Windows Azure-Blobs, Tables and Queues. You'll discover how to create storage accounts, how to upload and retrieve blobs and blob metadata, how to create, update and query tables, and how to create a simple service that uses a message queue for communication. Finally, you'll explore the use of Windows Azure Drives.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ConnectingApplications
AllProjects.Description: In this lab, you will create a Virtual Machine with SQL Server installed using Windows Azure Management Portal. Then you will modify a sample Web application to connect to the SQL Server using a public endpoint.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ConnectingApplicationsVNet
AllProjects.Description: In this lab, you will create a Virtual Machine with SQL Server installed using Windows Azure Management Portal. Then you will modify and deploy a sample Web application to a new Cloud Service. By the end, you will communicate the Cloud Service and the SQL Server VM through a Virtual Network.

AllProjects.Name: Demo-BuildClips
AllProjects.Description: In this demo we will show how to build and deploy an ASP.NET Web site that enables users to browse, play, and upload their own personal videos. We will then extend the web site to include Web APIs that power a Windows 8 experience. Finally, the web site project will be deployed to Windows Azure Web Sites and scaled using multiple paid shared instances.

AllProjects.Name: Demo-EventBuddy
AllProjects.Description: In this demo you will start with a disconnected application that manages events and sessions to later connect it utilizing Windows Azure Mobile Services to provide structured storage for events and sessions. In order to use authentication within the application, you will add Twitter (or Facebook) to your application and services. Following this you finish by sending Live Tiles using push notifications every time an attendee rates a session.

AllProjects.Name: Demo-EventBuddy-iOS
AllProjects.Description: An iOS app that functions as a component of the full Event Buddy demonstration.

AllProjects.Name: Presentation-WindowsPhoneAndWindowsAzureMobileServices
AllProjects.Description: Developing Windows Phone apps with Windows Azure Mobile Services

AllProjects.Name: Demo-WindowsPhoneAndMobileServices
AllProjects.Description: DemoScript for Deck Developing Windows Phone apps using Windows Azure Mobile Services

AllProjects.Name: HOL-WindowsAzureHDInsight
AllProjects.Description: Hands on Lab for HDInsight

AllProjects.Name: PRESENTATION-WindowsAzureHDInsight
AllProjects.Description: Windows Azure HDInsight Service Presentation

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ProvisioningAWindowsAzureVM
AllProjects.Description: Reference HOL for any lab which needs to provision a new Windows Azure Virtual Machine

AllProjects.Name: HOL-WindowsPhoneAndMobileServices
AllProjects.Description: This hands-on lab demonstrates how you can leverage Visual Studio 2012 and Windows Azure Mobile Services to add structured storage, push notifications, and integrated authentication to your Windows Phone application.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-HTMLAppAndMobileServices
AllProjects.Description: This hands-on lab shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an HTML app using Windows Azure Mobile Services. You will create both a new mobile service and a simple To do list app that stores app data in the new mobile service. Also you will perform server side validations and user authentication using Mobile Services features.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-AndroidAndMobileServices
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how to add a cloud-based backend service to an Android app using Windows Azure Mobile Services. You will create both a new mobile service and a simple TodoList app that stores app data in the new mobile service. Also you will perform server side validation, send push notifications and add user authentication using Mobile Services features.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-iOSAndMobileServices
AllProjects.Description: This hands-on lab shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to an iOS app using Windows Azure Mobile Services. You will create both a new mobile service and a simple To do list app that stores app data in the new mobile service. Also you will perform server side validations and user authentication using Mobile Services features.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ProvisioningAWindowsAzureVMPS
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab, you will create a new virtual network and then a new Windows Server 2012 virtual machine from a gallery image using the Windows Azure PowerShell Cmdlets.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-IntroToWindowsAzureMediaServices
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how you can use Visual Studio 2012 and Windows Azure Media Services to upload, encode, deliver and stream media content. Additionally, you will learn how to add a media player to your Windows Store applications and how to monetize your application using advertisements in the player.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-GettingStartedWindowsAzureStorage
AllProjects.Description: In this lab, you will learn the basics of Windows Azure Storage, how to create and configure storage accounts and how you can programmatically can access the different types of storage service. Blobs, Tables, and Queues are all available as part of the Windows Azure Storage account, and provide durable storage on the Windows Azure platform.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-IntroToACS2
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how to take advantage of the ACS for outsourcing authentication, managing multiple identity sources, performing basic authorization tasks, enhancing a classic ASP.NET Web application with advanced identity capabilities and taking control of the authentication experience.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-GoingLiveWindowsAzureWebSites
AllProjects.Description: Windows Azure provides a friendly subdomain on the azurewebsites.net domain so your users can access your web site using a URL like http://<mysite>.azurewebsites.net. However, if you configure your web sites for shared or standard mode, you can map your web site to your own domain name.  Secure Socket Layer (SSL) encryption is the most commonly used method of securing data sent across the internet, and assures visitors to your site that their transactions with your site are secure. This common task discusses how to enable SSL for a Windows Azure Web Site.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-ScalingWindowsAzureWebSites
AllProjects.Description: Windows Azure provides a set of features that allows you to monitor and scale your Web Site whenever is required. Moving static assets to a Storage account will leverage the load of your Web Site and with Auto-Scaling, your Windows Azure Web Sites will automatically scale accordingly with their traffic load. Additionally, you can use Endpoint monitoring to measure the response time of your Web site from different locations.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-MobileServicesCustomAPI
AllProjects.Description: Windows Azure Mobile Services enables you to define custom business logic that is run on the server. This logic is provided as JavaScript code that is stored and executed on the server. In Mobile Services, a server script is either registered to an insert, read, update, or delete operation on a given table or is assigned to a scheduled job. Server scripts have a main function along with optional helper functions. The signature of the main function depends on the whether the script is registered as a custom API, to a table operation, or to run as a scheduled job.

AllProjects.Name: HOL-IntroToWindowsAzureAD
AllProjects.Description: In this hands-on lab you will learn how to use Windows Azure Active Directory for implementing web single sign-on in an ASP.NET application. The instructions will focus on taking advantage of the directory tenant associated with your Windows Azure subscription.

AllProjects.Name: Fireworks
AllProjects.Description: Play virtual fireworks with your friends together over Internet using SignalR, HTML 5, and Javascript.

AllProjects.Name: weekly-planner-wp
AllProjects.Description: Weekly Planner is a Nokia example application for planning weekly schedule e.g. for students and school kids. The application demonstrates usage of pivot control, custom tabular UI component, content editing and storing local data.

AllProjects.Name: drumkitx
AllProjects.Description: A Windows Phone 8 port of the ​Drumkit XNA example using Direct3D and XAudio for fast graphics and low latency sample playback. This demo app lets you play percussion sounds by tapping the screen. You can record your beats, play them back later and also play drums on top of your latest recording.

AllProjects.Name: nfc-talk
AllProjects.Description: Simple chat application demonstrating NFC tap and Bluetooth search initiated connection establishment and further data transfer.

AllProjects.Name: drumkit-wp
AllProjects.Description: Drumkit XNA is a virtual drumkit that lets you play percussion sounds by  tapping sound pads. The application contains two views for playing, a simple view with 2D pads and a whole 3D like drumset to play with. You can record  your beats and play them back afterwards. It is also possible to play the  drums on top of your last recording. The application has been developed purely on top of XNA with Microsoft Visual Studio 2010 Express for Windows Phone.

AllProjects.Name: launchapp-tag-maker
AllProjects.Description: LaunchApp Tag Maker allows you to ceate NFC tags which can launch any apps available at ​http://www.windowsphone.com/ or apps that you installed youself.

AllProjects.Name: media-viewer
AllProjects.Description: Simple example for browsing photos and music on Windows Phone. Media Viewer Silverlight is based on FileList example application implemented with Qt Quick.

AllProjects.Name: moto-trial-racer-wp
AllProjects.Description: Motorcycle racing game on Windows Phone 7 & XNA Game Studio 4.0, demonstrating especially the use of Box2D.XNA. This application has been ported from corresponding Qt/QML example, and thereby also demonstrates and provides guidance on the porting and co-development between Qt and Windows Phone.

AllProjects.Name: native-filter-demo
AllProjects.Description: A simple demonstration project for Windows Phone 8 describing a way to create real-time filters for the camera viewfinder, using native code (C++). The project also provides a sample filter optimized using the NEON instruction set.

AllProjects.Name: solitaire-wp
AllProjects.Description: Solitaire game example developed with XNA Game Studio for Windows Phone 7.

AllProjects.Name: sudokumaster-wp
AllProjects.Description: Sudoku game developed with XAML. This example application has been developed with various technologies for several platforms, and thereby also demonstrates porting and co-development aspects between platforms.

AllProjects.Name: surveillance-camera
AllProjects.Description: A set of Nokia Developer example applications demonstrating the use of the Notifications API. A Windows Phone application acts as the notification service and a Qt Quick application acts as the client.

AllProjects.Name: lumia-sensorcore-simulation
AllProjects.Description: Lumia SensorCore simulation repository

AllProjects.Name: cqrs-journey-wiki
AllProjects.Description: CQRS Journey project wiki
